questions.text: Among the following options, a Drug not to be used with tadalafil is:
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Isosorbide dinitrate Tadalafil is a Phosphodiesterase 5 (PDE5) inhibitor . combination of Phosphodiesterase 5 inhibitors like Sildenafil, vardenafil, and tadalafil with organic nitrate vasodilators(e.g.Isosorbide dinitrate) can cause extreme hypotension. Nitrate+PDE 5 inhibitors→ Increased cGMP→ Vasodilation→Hypotension (most common), Increased Heart rate,Myocardial Infarction(rare) .

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options: - Options A, C, and D can be used with Tadalafil without any drug-drug interaction.

questions.text: Visual disturbances seen with vardenafil are due to the inhibition of:
questions.explanation:
Solution:

PDE 6 Sildenafil and vardenafil weakly inhibit the PDE6 enzyme. PDE6 enzyme is involved in photoreceptor signal transduction

Highyeild:

Side effects of PDE-5 inhibitors are mainly due to PDE-5 inhibition-related vasodilation headache nasal congestion dizziness facial flushing fall in BP loose motions Relaxation of the lower esophageal sphincter gastric reflux dyspepsia. Sildenafil, in addition, weakly inhibits the isoenzyme PDE-6 which is involved in photoreceptor transduction in the retina. Inhibition of PDE6 can produce visual disturbances, most notably changes in the perception of color hue or brightness. As such, impairment of color vision, especially blue-green discrimination , occurs in some recipients. Few cases of sudden loss of vision due to non-arteritic ischaemic optic neuropathy (NAION) among users of PDE-5 inhibitors have been reported.

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options: - Options A, B, and C are incorrect.

Solution:

Tadalafil

Highyeild:

Tadalafil- It is a more potent and longer-acting congener of sildenafil. t½ 18 hours and duration of action 24–36 hours. Peak plasma levels are attained between 30–120 min. Consequently, the time to onset of action may be longer. Side effects, risks, contraindications, and drug interactions are similar to sildenafil. In addition, back pain is reported, which has been ascribed to some degree of PDE-2 inhibition by tadalafil. Side effects of PDE II: Muscle ache and back pain. Symptoms resembling the common cold Headache Flushing Less common side effects: MR, CHF, Cardiomyopathy Because of its longer-lasting action, nitrates are contraindicated for up to 3 days after tadalafil. Due to its lower affinity for PDE-6 , visual disturbances occur less frequently. Tadalafil is also approved for use in PAH(Pulmonary Artery Hypertension).

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options: - Options A, B, and D are incorrect.

questions.text: The drug used for premature ejaculation is:
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Dapoxetine Dapoxetine is used for premature ejaculation.

Highyeild:

Premature Ejaculation Management- SSRI Modulates sympathetic reflexes for ejaculation Increase discharge latency reflex Taken 2 hr before sexual intercourse E.g., Dapoxetine Paroxetine TCAs Clomipramine

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options: - Options A, C, and D . Alprostadil, Papaverine, and Phentolamine are used in erectile dysfunction.

questions.text: A 45-year-old man came to OPD with a complaint that the drug he was taking caused an abnormal increase in the size of his breasts. The medical history of the patient was negative for past diseases or the use of alcohol or drugs. Two weeks earlier, the man was diagnosed with bilateral adrenal hyperplasia and had started an appropriate treatment. Which of the following drugs most likely caused the adverse effect in this patient?
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Spironolactone The patient’s bilateral adrenal hyperplasia most likely caused primary hyperaldosteronism , a disorder that is usually controlled by spironolactone. Spironolactone is a competitive aldosterone receptor antagonist , but it can bind to other steroid receptors. The blockade of androgen receptors is most likely the primary mechanism of spironolactone-induced gynecomastia. Gynecomastia is a well-known adverse effect of this drug; the overall prevalence is about 10% .

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options: - Options A, B, and C. can also cause gynecomastia, but they are not used to treat primary hyperaldosteronism.

questions.text: A 53-year-old woman was admitted to the hospital because of severe thoracic pain after a fall at home. Medical history was significant for mastectomy for breast cancer 8 years ago. An x-ray showed a fracture of three ribs and advanced osteoporosis. An appropriate therapy was started that included a drug that could lead to an increase in the bone mass index and could also decrease the risk of breast cancer reactivation. Which of the following drugs was most likely administered?
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Raloxifene Raloxifene is a selective estrogen receptor modulator . Such drugs can have estrogenic effects in bone but estrogen antagonist action on breast and uterine receptors. Raloxifene is approved both for the treatment of postmenopausal osteoporosis and for breast cancer risk reduction and therefore can be appropriate therapy in a subset of women with postmenopausal osteoporosis who are at risk of breast cancer, as in this case.

Highyeild:

Raloxifene Raloxifene is a selective estrogen receptor modulator . Such drugs can have estrogenic effects in bone but estrogen antagonist action on breast and uterine receptors. Raloxifene is approved both for the treatment of postmenopausal osteoporosis and for breast cancer risk reduction and therefore can be appropriate therapy in a subset of women with postmenopausal osteoporosis who are at risk of breast cancer, as in this case.

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options: - Option: A. Anastrozole can reduce the risk of breast cancer but has no effect or a negative effect (due to a further decrease in estrogen levels) on bone mass. Option: B. Alendronate can increase the bone mass index more than raloxifene but has not been proven to reduce breast cancer Bisphosphonates are used to treat bone metastases of breast cancer. Option: D. Testosterone-androgens and progestins are not used to treat postmenopausal osteoporosis.
